19709.<pipipi_low>「やっているね <pc>くん。\n 私も 聞き込みしてみ:
<pipipi_low>Good work, <pc>! Anything new?
I also tried asking around but sadly i
couldn't gather any new clues, no luck.

19710.「なんじゃ。ルベカの探偵ごっこか。\n 子守唄について 聞きたいとは\n 何を:
What's this? Rubecca playing detective again?
Are you wondering about old lullabies?

19711.「バーバサさんは 声が聞こえるとか\n 闇に呑まれるとか そういう歌詞の\n 子:
Miss Barbasa, do you happen to know about any
lullabies with lyrics about hearing voices
or being swallowed by darkness, like that?

19712.「おお それは あの歌のことじゃな。\n ルベカが 小さいころに\n 唄ってやっ:
Oh! You're talking about THAT song? I have a
feeling that I sang this song to you when
you were little.

19713.<center>ねーむれ～ よい子よ ねーむれ～。\nねーむれ～ 今すぐ ねーむ:
Slumber good child, Slumber right now... ♪
If you can't take that nap...
You'll fall into a trap... ♪

19714.「昔は よう唄われとったんじゃが\n 子供たちが 気味悪がってのう。\n いつの:
It used to be sung a lot in the past, but the
children started finding it creepy. Soon
after, everyone stopped singing it.

19715.「おまえが死ぬ。命の輝きが 闇に呑まれる……。\n そうよ。この子守唄だわ……。:
Incoming death, Spark of life fading away...
Yeah, that's right, this is the lullaby.

19716.「バーバサさん その子守唄について\n 他に 知っていることは ありませんか！？:
Miss Barbasa, do you have more information
about that lullaby!?

19717.「はて……。これを 唄ってくれた母が\n 昔 この村に立ち寄った 旅の詩人が作っ:
Well... My mother, who sang this to me, once
told me that it was written by a traveling
poet who stopped by this village long ago.

19718.「その詩人は 世界を旅して回り\n 旅先で聞いた出来事なんかを もとにして\n:
That poet traveled around the world, gathering
stories and events from the places he went,
using them as inspiration for his songs.

19719.「……ということは この子守唄にも \n もとになった出来事か何かが\n あった:
...So, with this we can speculate that one
of this events or stories may have served
as inspiration for this lullaby, right?

19720.「おそらく その詩人は レーンの村の次は\n 新たな歌の題材を探して ジュレット:
Perhaps the poet, after visiting Lane Village,
went to seek new inspirations for songs, and
traveled to more places like, Julet Town?

19721.「それじゃ ジュレットのお年寄りなら\n その詩人のことを 知ってる人がいる\n:
If that's the case, there's a possibility that
some elder from Julet Town might know more
about that traveling poet...

19722.「ん～……。ちょっと 頼りない情報だけど \n ジュレットの町の お年寄りにも聞:
Hmmm... It may be a somewhat unreliable piece
of information but, would you like to ask
to some old folks on Julet about the poet?

19723.「私も行くけど だまって出かけると\n お父さん うるさいから 外出許可とってく:
I'll come along too, but first i need to get
permission from my father to leave without
causing a fuss so, go ahead <pc>.

19724.「……これからは この女の子のことを\n 調べていこうと思うの。\n そのときは:
... From now on, i'll investigate more about
this girl. When the time comes i'll ask
you to lend me your strength again.

19725.「だけど今は 早く家に帰って 休みたいわ。\n <pc>くん またね……。:
But for now, i just want to go home... we
deserve some rest. Goodbye for now, and
take care, <pc>.

28437.<center>おまえが死ぬと～ 聞こえる あの声～。\n命の～ 輝きが 闇に呑:
In that trap you'll hear a voice...
Death will come, you have no choice... ♪

28438.<center>名前を～ 呼ばれる その前ーに～。\nねーむれ～ 今すぐ ねーむ:
If you hear your name tonight...
Spark of life won't be on sight...
Slumber good child, Slumber right now... ♪

28478.「昔を思いだして ちょっと 唄ってみようかね。:
Thinking back to the old days, let's sing a
little.

28479.<pipipi_low>「むむっ。もしかして 何か\n 手がかりを見つけたのかね: <pipipi_low>Hmm, did you find a clue in there?

28480.「ちょっと 私に貸して。読んでみるから！: Can i borrow it for a moment? I'll read it!

28481.「……ジュレットの町。立ち並ぶ貝がらの家。\n 浜辺に集う恋人たち。愛の歌。別れ:
... Julet Town: the beauty of shell houses,
Lovers in the beach, the fragrant sea breeze,
Songs for couples, and songs for break-ups.

28482.「ふむふむ……。このノートには\n 歌の題材に なりそうなものが \n 書かれて:
This notebook seems to have some potential
subjects for songs, things that could be
used as inspiration.

28484.「この真実 いただきます！: We're closer to the one and only truth!

28485.「これは 重要な手がかりよ！\n よく 見つけだしてくれたわ。\n これは お礼:
This is the best clue so far! I'm so glad you
found them out. Take this as a thank you.

28486.「これが レーンの村に来た 詩人のノートなら \n あの子守唄のもとになった出来:
If this notebook is from the poet who visited
Lane Village, then it must contain the event
that inspired the song. If we can find it...

28488.「……レーンの村。興味深い話。\n 死を呼ぶ少女。恐れる村人。:
Lane Village: An Intriguing Tale
The girl who brings death,
The one that frights villagers.

28489.「……名前を呼ばれて 死ぬ村人。\n 少女が使う 死の言葉とは……。:
...Villagers die when hearing their name. 
The girl that uses the speech of death...

28490.「…………が死ぬ。命の輝き 闇に呑まれる。: ...engulfs the spark of life to bring demise.

28491.「これって やっぱり……。\n あれは 空耳なんかじゃ なかったんだわ……。:
This... I knew it, i wasn't mishearing it
after all. It wasn't my imagination.

28492.「……あのね <pc>。\n 変なことを言うようだけど 聞いてほしいの。:
...Hey <pc>. I know this may 
sound crazy but i please hear me out.

28493.「私のアタマの中でね。\n ときどき 女の子の声が 聞こえるの。: Sometimes i hear a girl's voice in my head.

28494.「…………が死ぬ。\n 命の輝きが 闇に呑まれる……って。: The demise. Spark of life being engulfed...

28495.「なんだか 気味が悪いし……。\n ただの空耳だって 思うようにしてた。:
It feels eerie, and i've trying to convince
myself that it was just my imagination.

28496.「だけど 古い村人名簿から\n 女の子の名前が 消されてるのを見たとき\n すご:
But the moment i saw the girl's name erased
from the Old Villager List. I started
having a truly uneasy feeling...

28497.「昔 聴いた子守唄に アタマの中の声と\n 同じ言葉があったのを 思いだしたの！:
I remembered that the words echoing inside
my head, were in a lullaby long time ago!

28498.「私のアタマの中に 聞こえるのは\n たぶん この女の子の声なんだよ……。: That girl may be that voice inside my head...

28499.「なんで 私に話しかけるの？\n この女の子は いったい 何者なの！？: Why is she talking to me? Who is this girl!?

28500.「村人名簿からも 名前が消されてるなんて\n この女の子は どうなったの……。:
What happened to this mysterious girl... 
Why was her name removed from that list...
